data.title: Off tha Beat Episode #13:
data.meta_description: Ask any true fan of New York City hip-hop “who were some of the most influential rappers to come from Queens?” you can expect to hear the name, Mobb Deep. Considered by some as the fathers of the…
data.text:
Ask any true fan of New York City hip-hop “who were some of the most influential rappers to come from Queens?” you can expect to hear the name, Mobb Deep.

Considered by some as the fathers of the East Coast “hardcore” rap sound, Mobb Deep are a hip-hop duo— Prodigy and Havoc — from the Queensbridge housing projects who got their start as the “Poetical Prophets,” which they later changed after Jive Records refused to sign them as a pair.

Mobb Deep were in their late teens when they signed a deal with 4th & B’way Records for their debut album, Juvenile Hell.

While it wasn’t the commercial success they had hoped for the project would introduce them to producers DJ Premier and Large Professor — who later produced Illmatic, the 1994 debut by Nas — and set the stage for their most acclaimed album to date, The Infamous.
